title: About me
text:
My name is David Carayon and I’m a statistician / Data Scientist working at the French National Research Institute for Agriculture, Food and the Environment (INRAE).
My work mainly focuses on environmental evaluation. I build evaluation methods based on composite and statistically relevant indicators and also develop tools and software associated with these methods.
My main programming langages/skills are R (tidyverse, tidymodels, shiny), Quarto/Rmarkdown, SQL and Python.

Selected R packages and projects
 IDEATools | Individual and Group Farm Sustainability Assessments using the IDEA4 Method (more info on this method here)
 ShinyIDEA | An R Shiny App providing the IDEATools package functions in an easy to use user interface. (live app here)
 InraeThemes | Unofficial ggplot2, Rmarkdown, Sass and Quarto themes based on my research institute graphical charter.
 SK8 | An institutionnal project to deploy R Shiny apps through Kubernetes using GitLab/Kubernetes/Docker (French poster presentation here)
 IDGF | An R package dedicated to the French Guiana Diatom Index (FGDI) method (paper here)
